Alas, the reason I switched to photonvision (amongst other things)

Limelight can’t detect multiple targets in the same frame, but photonvision can.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-02T19:01:27.916Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":425463,"topic_slug":"limelight-multiple-retroreflective-targets","display_username":"Newton Crosby Jr","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51042,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-multiple-retroreflective-targets/425463/5","custom_user_title":"Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3138466,"name":"Newton Crosby Jr","username":"NewtonCrosbyJr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/newtoncrosbyjr/{size}/163897_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-02T19:05:03.090Z","cooked":"

The last time I checked (last year) what would happen is while the limelight may detect multiple contours, it will only return one target. This can lead to potential issues with randomly shifting your lock between two equally viable targets, which is why I prefer photonvision. It will return multiple targets, but it will sort them based off user-provided parameters so when you call for a target in code, it will only give you one object. Technically it will return a list, but the list is organized so you can call an item knowing actually what it is.

@jruben4 @Owen_Busler @NewtonCrosbyJr This is now possible.

Introducing Limelight Lib General Forum
Introducing Limelight Lib Java CPP Limelight Lib is a single-file library that makes Limelight easier than ever. With one line of code, you can start using the full JSON output of Limelight to build more versatile software. All you need to do is copy the file into your robot project. You don’t need to instantiate any objects to interact with your Limelights. The library is meant to be used in a stateless/functional manner. Java: LimelightResults llresults = LimelightHelpers.getLatestResul…
